sense.name: develop biologically
sense.examples: Kittens and puppies mature quickly compared to human babies. The cheese is matured for two years in cool dark caves. This Cabernet-Franc has matured beautifully. (aged wine) Populations in the developed world are maturing at a rapid pace. The pears matured and fell off the tree. The boil matured and began to secrete pus.

sense.name: formulate, elaborate, articulate
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[topic[abstract]] MATURE PP NP1[topic[abstract]] MATURE ADVP[manner] Note: this sense is a metaphoric extension of Sense 1
sense.examples: His writing style has matured significantly since his last novel. There was no time for their acquaintance to mature into a friendship. The industry has matured to the point that it's harder to be a start-up in it now.

sense.name: become due
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[topic] MATURE ADVP[manner] NP1[topic] MATURE PP[temporal] Note: usually some financial instrument
sense.examples: These bonds mature in 30 years. These bonds will mature when Johnny starts college. This insurance policy matures more slowly than that one.
